This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It contains a short, human-readable description of an entity or source. This is usually displayed at the top of the page to help with disambiguation in the same way as the Wikipedia template [[Wikipedia:Template:About|about]]. It can also be displayed in query results.
Try to use as little wiki markup as possible in the description. Italics should be used where needed. Wiki links will not work.
Make the text as short as possible but do include all of an entity's names and titles as this makes it easier to search for them.
A content warning should be added to this property if a page needs one.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It defines the type of entity that a page represents.

revision.comment: what to do if Wikidata conflates settlement and parish
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an item ID at [[Wikidata:Main_Page|Wikidata]]. Only the item ID (usually starting with Q and followed by a series of digits) should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/entity/$1]]
There should be an exact one to one correspondence for people and animals, but other entity types might only be an approximate match because of differences between how By The Sword Linked and Wikidata define entities or because of inconsistencies within Wikidata.
Where a Wikidata item covers a settlement and a parish at the same time, we use it only to refer to the settlement.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the first date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact start date is known, use [[Property:Has definite start date|Has definite start date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest known date that an entity existed. This is not necessarily the same as the last date that it existed, which might be unknown. If the exact end date is known, use [[Property:Has definite end date|Has definite end date]] instead. It can be used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which [[GLAM]] holds a collection, manuscript text, early printed copy, or text section. This is a direct relationship between each item and its GLAM, separate from the hierarchy represented with [[Property:Has parent]]. The GLAM name qualifies the references given in [[Property:Has orderable reference]] and [[Property:Has citable reference]].

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Property:Has full reference]] to [[Property:Has citable reference]]
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. You can use it to enter the full catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) used to cite a manuscript, including folio numbers if any. This does not have to be a volume that can be ordered individually. For the reference used to order a document, use [[Property:Has orderable reference]]. If a collection within an archive's catalogue hierarchy does not have a corresponding catalogue reference, please put 'See lower levels' here.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It shows the catalogue reference (excluding the GLAM name) that can be used to order a manuscript text or collection in the archive that holds it. If a text or collection is at a lower level than a volume that can be ordered, put the lowest level that can be ordered here. The full reference used to cite it goes in [[Property:Has citable reference]]. If the collection is at a higher level than anything that can be ordered individually, please enter 'See lower levels'.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It links to the main subjects of a source. You should only include an entity as a main subject if the source is wholly or mainly about that entity. You can include multiple subjects for the same source, but try to use as few as possible.

These are special values that can be entered in properties of page type. Instead of linking to a known entity, they indicate that the value is unknown or not applicable.
[[Category:Property values]]

revision.comment: changed definition because several other properties merged into this one
revision.text:
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It identifies any person or organization that created or contributed to a text. This includes:
* author of a book, article, thesis or manuscript. This includes the author of a foreword. * editor or translator of a book or article. * illustrator of a book, article or manuscript. * publisher or printer of a book published in the 17th century. We do not record semantic data for publishers of books published earlier or later than the 17th century. * person or organization that collected or created a whole [[collection]].
For people named as booksellers on the title pages of 17th-century books, use [[Property:To be sold by]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the person or organization that a manuscript document was addressed to. It is typically used for:
* letters * petitions * warrants * account books that were submitted to a committee

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the earliest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the latest date covered by a source. This can be before the source itself was created. For example, memoirs and account books can refer to periods before they were written.
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

{{#default_form:Manuscript text}} All pages in this category are manuscript texts but they can be [[Property:is instance of|instances of]] many different types.
[[Category:Default form categories]]

All text and data (apart from embedded maps from OpenStreetMap) are available under $1 licence. Where attribution is required for data reused from other sources, this will be stated on the relevant pages.

revision.comment: do not take as legal advice
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the current copyright status of the original text of a source as far as we can tell, but should not be taken as legal advice. Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Copyright status]].

This lists allowed values of [[Property:Has copyright status]].
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows the licence conditions of the original text of a source. Images of unpublished manuscripts may have different conditions from the text.
Allowed values are listed in [[:Category:Licence conditions]], and more will be added in future to cover all possible Creative Commons licences.

This lists allowed values of [[Property:Has licence condition]].
[[Category:Property values]]

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Category:Manuscript text type definitions]] to [[Category:Manuscript text types]] without leaving a redirect: Text replacement - "type definitions" to "types"
revision.text:
Pages in this category define types of manuscript texts. This is used in the 'Type' field in [[Form:Manuscript text]] which feeds the value to [[Property:Is instance of]]. Pages should be included in this category to make them available in the dropdown list in the form.
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows which manuscript or printed text a section ultimately belongs to. This is not always the same as the value of [[Property:Has parent]]. The value of '''is section of''' should never be another section, only a manuscript text or printed copy.

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Category:Relationship types]] to [[Category:Command relationship types]] without leaving a redirect
revision.text:
Definitions of relationship types used as values for [[Property:Has role]] in subobjects generated by [[Template:Command relationship subobject]].
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the subordinate in the relationship.
The value of this property is usually set automatically by a template so it doesn't have to be entered.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that one entity is a parent of another. The exact meaning depends on the context.
Note that it never represents:
* a relationship between two people as this is outside the scope of this project. * a relationship between copies, editions and works. For this, use [[Property:Is version of]] instead.
== Command relationships ==
It is used by subobjects in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] to show which unit or other entity is the parent in the relationship. Depending on the relationship type, this may be an ancestor rather than an immediate parent.
Where the child unit is an address and [[Property:Has role|relationship type]] is [[military occupation]], the parent should have two values: one should be an [[:Category:Allegiance factions|allegiance faction]], and the other the specific unit which occupied the place. This is to make it easier to generate maps of territory controlled by factions.
== Collections, manuscript texts, and printed copies ==
It shows a source's immediate parent in the hierarchy of the archive that holds it.
* the parent of a collection can be another collection or a GLAM * the parent of a manuscript text can be another manuscript text, a collection, or sometimes a GLAM * the parent of an early printed copy can be a collection or a GLAM * the parent of a text section is the manuscript text or printed copy that it's part of, or another section if the text has a more complicated structure
== Event ==
It shows that one event was part of another, such as:
* an assault or sally that was part of a siege. * a battle or skirmish that was part of a bigger raid. For example, the battle of Chalgrove was part of the raid on Chinnor but was a distinct part of it that needs a page in its own right. * a battle or capture of a fort that was part of a bigger series of battles, such as the individual parts of the battles of Lostwithiel. * a meeting that happened on one day but was part of a longer session

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the gender of a historical person or animal. For the purposes of this site, gender is represented as an external social status. It should not be assumed that this matches a person's biological sex or preferred gender identity, neither of which are easy to discover for early-modern people. A person's gender status can be classed as 'confirmed' or 'assumed' depending on the strength of evidence from primary sources. Many early-modern people cannot be strongly confirmed as male or female.
Values are listed in [[:Category:Genders]]. Note that humans and animals have different gender statuses.
More genders can be added in future if needed. The property can take multiple values in case a person had more than one gender status. Female soldiers or sailors who passed as men will be classed as male and female.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a page name at the [[MarineLives:MarineLives|Marine Lives wiki]]. Only the page name should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.marinelives.org/wiki/$1]]
You should only use this property for Marine Lives pages that correspond to the same entity whose page here the property is used on. You can also use interwiki links in free text to link to any Marine Lives page by using the prefix 'marinelives:'. For example, if you type <nowiki>[[marinelives:HCA 13/53]]</nowiki> it will be displayed as [[marinelives:HCA 13/53]].

This category holds values for [[Property:Has gender status]] and is used to populate autocomplete suggestions in [[Form:Agent]].
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents the rank or position that a person held in an organization.
Values are listed in [[:Category:Personnel roles]].
This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents the Address, Area or Unit that an Agent was a member of.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects created by [[Template:Personnel subobject]]. It represents an Agent who was a member of an Area or Unit, or resident of an Address.

This is the "Personnel" template. It is used by [[Form:Agent]] and should not be used separately. |- | {{#arraymap:{{{Member of|Unknown}}}|;|xx|[[xx]]|

These are ranks or positions that people could hold in organizations. They are used as values by [[Form:Agent]] and [[Template:Personnel subobject]].
[[Category:Property values]]

Sub-categories of this category contain lists of pages that are used as values for certain semantic properties where the property is of type Page and the values are not specific individual entities such as people. These lists are used to populate autocomplete suggestions or dropdown lists in forms. The pages define what the term means in human readable terms and links to a Wikidata ID if available.
[[Category:Categories]]

Sub-categories of this category are associated with a default form. Each one contains all instances of pages created and edited with its default form.
[[Category:Categories]]

This category is added automatically by templates. It is used to populate autocomplete values in forms for [[Property:Created by]]. It includes people and organizations.
It is automatically added by these templates:
* [[Template:Agent]] * [[Template:Author]] * [[Template:Area]] * [[Template:Unit]]
[[Category:Autocomplete combined categories]] __HIDDENCAT__

This category is added automatically by templates. It is used to populate autocomplete values for [[Property:Has main subject]] in forms for sources. It includes people, places, organizations and events.
[[Category:Autocomplete combined categories]] __HIDDENCAT__

This category is added by templates. It is used to populate autocomplete values for [[Property:Has parent]] in [[Form:Manuscript text section]]. It contains manuscript texts and sections, which can both be parents of another section.
[[Category:Autocomplete combined categories]] __HIDDENCAT__

This is a property of type [[Has type::Geographic coordinates]]. It records a geographic point that roughly corresponds to the location of an Address or [[combat event]].
Coordinates are assumed to use the WGS84 system, which is the system for geographic coordinates used by Google Maps, Geonames, Open Street Map, Wikidata and many others but is different from the Ordnance Survey National Grid. ETRS89 geodetic coordinates are near enough that they can be entered here but the software will treat them as WGS84 afterwards.
Latitude comes first, and longitude second, separated by a comma. You can enter the values as decimal degrees or as degrees, minutes and seconds. They are automatically displayed on the page as degrees, minutes and seconds.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID at [http://www.geonames.org/ Geonames]. This is used in addition to Wikidata IDs because Geonames tends to make a more rigorous distinction between populated places and administrative units, whereas Wikidata sometimes conflates both into one entity which has two Geonames IDs. You should only enter the ID number here, not the full URL, or the html page appended to the ID number. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.geonames.org/$1/]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a unit ID at [http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/ Vision of Britain]. Only the ID number should be entered in this property. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.visionofbritain.org.uk/unit/$1]]

This category includes all units and areas. It is used for populating autocomplete in [[Property:Has parent]] in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]].
It is automatically added by:
* [[Template:Area]] * [[Template:Unit]]
[[Category:Autocomplete combined categories]] __HIDDENCAT__

revision.comment: Admin moved page [[Category:Area type definitions]] to [[Category:Area types]] without leaving a redirect: Text replacement - "type definitions" to "types"
revision.text:
These pages define entity types for pages created and edited using [[Form:Area]]. An area usually represents a civil or ecclesiastical administrative unit. They have boundaries which can change over time but cannot change position from day to day.
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an ID from Ordnance Survey OpenNames. This is used for settlements in Great Britain in addition to other identifiers because OS data has the most complete and reliable coverage. It should be left blank for settlements outside Great Britain.
[[External formatter uri::http://data.ordnancesurvey.co.uk/id/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used by subobjects that represent a temporary location in [[Template:Location subobject]]. It refers to the unit or agent whose location is represented. The value is always set automatically by the template.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the approximate location of an entity in relation to an address. 'Located in or near' means that the location is deliberately kept vague because 17th-century sources don't always allow us to be more specific. It is used by:
* Events ([[Template:Event]]) * Addresses ([[Template:Address]]) if the address is a [[building]], [[street], or [[bridge]], but not if it is a [[settlement]]. * Location subobjects ([[Template:Location subobject]]) which link units or agents to their locations on known dates

<noinclude>This template is used by [[Form:Location page]]. It should not be used separately.</noinclude><includeonly>
{{#switch:{{{Page type|Subpages}}}
|Map=Map of locations of [[{{ROOTPAGENAME}}]].

From: {{#tag:date||when={{{From|1600-01-01 JL}}} }}

{{#ask:
[[Has WGS84 coordinates::+]]
[[-Located in or near::<q>[[Is location of::{{ROOTPAGENAME}}]] [[Has latest known date::>{{{From|1600-01-01 JL}}}]] [[Has earliest known date::<{{{To|1699-12-31 JL}}}]]</q>]]
| ?Has WGS84 coordinates
| format =leaflet
| default = No coordinates found.
}}
|Subpages=Locations of [[{{ROOTPAGENAME}}]].

Subpages of this page:

{{Special:PrefixIndex/{{FULLPAGENAME}}/|stripprefix=1|hideredirects=1}}

Create a new subpage:

{{#forminput:form=Location page|query string=super_page={{FULLPAGENAME}} }}
|Table=Locations of [[{{ROOTPAGENAME}}]]:

{{{!}} class="swordinfotable"
!Location
!Earliest
!Latest
!Source
{{{Locations|}}}
{{!}}}
}}

[[Category:Location pages]]</includeonly>

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Form:Locations]] to [[Form:Location page]]: changing to match page template
revision.text:
This is the "Location page" form. Pages that use this form should only be created from red links on Agent or Unit pages, or using the form input on existing pages that use this form. {{{for template|Location page}}} Select page type: {{{field|Page type|values=Map,Subpages,Table|input type=dropdown|show on select=Map=>locmap;Subpages=>locsubpages;Table=>loctable}}}
Display a map of locations. This can be limited to a range of dates using the boxes below. Leave both boxes blank to show all locations regardless of date. {{{field|From|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} {{{field|To|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}}
A list of subpages will be displayed automatically when you save the page. Nothing needs to be entered here. To create a new subpage, use the input on the saved page.
You can add locations to this page here. {{{field|Locations|holds template}}}
{{{end template}}} {{{for template|Location subobject|embed in field=Location page[Locations]|multiple|add button text=Add location}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Location: |{{{field|Location|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|list|delimiter|values from category=Addresses|property=Located in or near|size=45}}} |- ! From: | {{{field|Earliest date type|input type=dropdown|values=earliest known date,definite start date|default=earliest known date}}}{{{field|Earliest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! To: |{{{field|Latest date type|input type=dropdown|values=latest known date,definite end date|default=latest known date}}}{{{field|Latest date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sources: |{{{field|Location ref|input type=textarea|rows=5|cols=45|placeholder=You can use wiki markup to create links here.}}} |} {{{end template}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

These pages contain location data for units and agents. {{#default_form:Location page}}
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is a parent property used to query for sources that are related to an entity in any way. It is not displayed directly in entity pages or added directly in forms. Instead it is silently added by templates, with the same values that are used in any of these properties:
* [[Property:Addressed to]] * [[Property:Created by]] * [[Property:Made available at]] * [[Property:Mentions]] * [[Property:Possibly mentions]] * [[Property:Signed by]] * [[Property:To be sold by]]
This creates a hierarchy similar to subproperties but makes it easier to display property values in query results.

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Property:Possibly relates to]] to [[Property:Possibly mentions]]: renamed to better reflect how it's now used
revision.text: This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used when an entity mentioned in a source can't be positively identified but there are one or more possibilities.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a source mentions an entity which has been positively identified, but does not specify any particular role in the document, such as author or addressee.

This category supplies autocomplete values for the Physical parent field in [[Form:Collection]]. It contains all pages that are in [[:Category:Collections]] or [[:Category:GLAMs]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents an International Standard Book Number. It can accept either ISBN 10 or ISBN 13 numbers, but it should only have one value. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Special:BookSources/$1]]
This links to a special page at Wikidata where you can find links to search for the book in library catalogues and online booksellers.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used to link:
* journal articles to the journal they were published in * serial volumes to the serial they were published in * chapters to the edited collection they were published in

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a Digital Object Identifier, which is typically used to refer to a journal article or thesis. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://doi.org/$1]]
The DOI for the version of record should only be used for that version. A self-archived article either has its own DOI or no DOI.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year of publication of a [[book format]] as stated on the title page or in a catalogue record. It is not stored as a date and does not make any claims about which calendar is used.
This property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons if an edition consists of multiple volumes that were published in different years.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the issue number of the journal issue that an [[article]] was published in. For volume number, use [[Property:Has volume number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]].
For [[article]]s published in a journal, it represents the volume number of the journal volume that an article was published in. For issue number, use [[Property:Has issue number]]. An article might have both an issue and volume number, or only one or the other, depending on how the journal is numbered. A volume typically covers one year, but this could vary. A journal article should usually have only one volume number.
For a [[book edition]] that is part of a series, this property represents the volume number within the series. It is represented at the level of editions, not formats. If the edition has multiple volumes, the property can have multiple values separated by semi-colons, each one giving the number of a volume. For example, I.G. Philip's edition of ''The Journal of Sir Samuel Luke'' published by Oxfordshire Record Society, would have these values:
29;31;33
We do not record volume numbers for a book that has more than one volume but is not part of a series (for example, Warburton's ''Memoirs of Prince Rupert and the Cavaliers''). This information can usually be found in external resources linked to by external identifiers. In some cases, volumes of a book may need to be represented as different editions or formats.
This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It represents the full title of a [[book edition]], [[article]] or [[thesis]]. It is '''not''' split into main title and subtitle.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It identifies a thesis at EThOS (the British Library's e-theses online service). It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://ethos.bl.uk/OrderDetails.do?uin=$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] starts. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the page number on which an [[article]] ends. If the page number in the original text is a Roman numeral, leave this blank as it can only take Arabic numerals. Page numbers in Roman numerals can still be entered in the text of [[Property:Has description]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to an Amazon Standard Identification Number used to identify products at Amazon. Only the ID number should be entered in this property. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/$1/]]
You should not create links to Amazon on this wiki without using this property.

This category is used to populate autocomplete suggestions in [[Template:Personnel subobject]], which is used in [[Form:Agent]]. It includes any entity which can have personnel.
It is added automatically by these templates:
* [[Template:Unit]] * [[Template:Area]] * [[Template:Address]]
It does not include [[:Category:Allegiance factions|Allegiance factions]] because these are not directly used in personnel relationships, only in command relationships between organizations.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Number]]. It represents the year in which a [[thesis]] was complete.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the bookseller who was to sell an early edition of a book or serial. A person should only be added to this property if they are named on the title page of the edition in question, otherwise the value should be [[None]]. This property is only used for editions published in the mid-17th century.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a citation number at the [http://ESTC.bl.uk/ English Short Title Catalogue]. Only the value of ESTC Citation No. ('''not''' ESTC, System No.) should be entered. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://ESTC.bl.uk/$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::URL]]. It is used for:
* [[article]] if the official version of record is available online and has a URL but not a DOI. * [[book format]] to link to a page for this edition at the publisher's website, where you may be able to buy a copy. It should '''not''' be used to link to any other retailer. * [[collection]], [[Form:manuscript text|manuscript text]], and [[printed copy]] to link to an official catalogue record in the online catalogue of the [[GLAM]] that holds it. * [[thesis]] to link to an official catalogue record in the online catalogue of the university at which it was completed. * [[GLAM]] and [[serial publication]] to link to its official website.

revision.comment: /* Create a page without a form */
revision.text:
You can create a new page for any entity or source that is within the scope of this project if it doesn't already have a page in this wiki. Pages are usually created by forms. The lists below tell you which form to use for which type of thing. Most forms will ask you to enter the name of the page that you want to create. Please check [[Help:Page name conventions]] before deciding what to call it, but don't worry too much about getting it wrong as we can easily change it later. Some types of pages have numbers automatically assigned, so you don't need to specify a name for the page.
You can also create pages by clicking on red links. In this case you may be forwarded to the correct form, or you may be taken to another page that asks you to choose a form. You may need to look at the present page to help you choose the right form (you can have this page open in another tab or window if it helps).
== Historical entities ==
These entities represent individual people, places, organizations or events that existed in the 17th century.
Location and Event pages for each unit or agent should always be created using the red links on that unit or agent's page. This will always forward you to the correct form.
=== People and animals ===
* [[Form:Agent|Agent]] for historical people and animals of any other species who were alive between about 1637 and 1660. Can also be used for people who died before 1637 if it's possible and useful to record the location of their remains . * [[Form:Author|Author]] for people who were not alive in this period and are only included as authors or editors of sources.
=== Places and organizations ===
* [[Form:Address|Address]] is used for physical locations such as towns, villages, buildings and streets. * [[Form:Unit|Unit]] is for organizations that occupied a specific location and could move (even if they didn't move much in practice). This includes: ** military units ** ships ** committees ** guilds and companies ** households * [[Form:Area|Area]] is for administrative organizations that covered a geographical area. The boundaries of the area may have changed, but the location of the organization can't move drastically. This includes: ** wartime associations ** parishes and their sub-units, such as townships and chapelries ** ecclesiastical units such as rural deaneries, archdeaconries, dioceses, and peculiar jurisdictions ** civil units such as hundreds, boroughs, and counties. Counties will usually be represented by several areas: *** county at large (the largest extent of a shire, including any corporate counties) *** commission of the peace *** shrievalty *** lieutenancy * parliamentary constituencies, including boroughs, shires and corporate counties. A constituency will always be represented as a separate entity even if it has the same name and area as a county or borough.
=== Events ===
* [[Form:Event|Event]] is now used for all battles, sieges and other combat events, and for formal meetings of organizations. In future it could be used for other types of events.
== Sources ==
* [[Form:GLAM|GLAM]] represents a gallery, library, archive, or museum that holds manuscripts, early printed books, images, or material objects (although images and objects will not be implemented until a later phase of this project) * [[Form:Collection|Collection]] is currently used to represent a collection of manuscripts held by a GLAM. It can cover any level from an individual volume containing multiple documents to a series of volumes. Collections can be parents of other collections. Note that some manuscript volumes are counted as [[Form:Manuscript text|Manuscript text]] if the whole volume is part of the same text such as a diary. At [[The National Archives of the UK (TNA)|TNA]] a collection can cover a department code, series, sub-series, piece, or part within a piece. At the [[British Library]] it can cover an individual volume or a series of volumes. * [[Form:Author|Author]] is for authors or editors of sources who were not alive between about 1637 and 1660. * [[Form:Serial publication|Serial publication]] can represent any serial publication published at any time. This includes: ** 17th-century newsbooks ** modern academic journals ** magazines ** record society series ** a series of monographs or edited collections
Publishers and publication places are not represented except for printed editions published between about 1637 and 1660. In these cases the publishers are historical people or organizations.
=== Works ===
* [[Form:Work|Work]] is used for works that have more than one version (including printed editions and manuscripts copies). * if a work only has one book edition and no other versions, work level is combined with edition level using [[Form:Book|Book]]. * if a work has only been published once as an article, work level is combined with article level using [[Form:Article|Article]].
For the purposes of this project, a written work can be:
* a text that has at least one published version * an unpublished text that has at least two manuscript versions that can reasonably be classed as versions of the same text. This can include lost manuscripts that are known to have existed in the past.
Manuscript texts that only have one known version are represented only at copy level, not at work level.
(All works are now named. We are not using unnamed works any more so the relevant form, template and category have been deleted.)
An edition can have more than one parent work if it is a compilation of more than one work.
=== Manuscripts ===
* [[Form:Manuscript text|Manuscript text]] is used for an individual text that survives in manuscript * {{#formlink:form=Lost manuscript text|link text=Lost manuscript text|link type=}} is for a text that is known to have existed in manuscript but has since been lost. This can be because it is known to have been destroyed, or because its current location is unknown. It can also be used for manuscripts that are known to survive in a private collection if the owner does not want to be identified, or if the collection does not have formal catalogue references. This form automatically generates a number for the page name, so you don't need to choose a name before you create the page. * [[Form:Manuscript text section|Manuscript text section]] is a division of a text. This can be: ** physical, such as a page or folio ** logical, such as a chapter ** arbitrary, such as a passage of a narrative that covers a certain event, even if the author didn't distinguish it in any way (this can be useful for linking accounts of battles, for example) * [[Form:Blank|Blank]] represents one or more blank pages in a manuscript. It has very few properties but is useful for indicating that there is no text. Its parent can be a collection, a manuscript text or a section.
Whether lost or extant, a manuscript text usually represents one individual document such as:
* a letter * a petition * a pay warrant * an account book * a diary
A text can be a parent of another text, for example:
* a letter book is a text, and each letter copied into it is also a text * an account book is a text; if it contains copies of warrants and/or receipts, each of these is also a text * a volume of a probate register is a text, and each will copied into it is also a text
=== Published editions: books ===
[[Form:Book|Book]] represents editions of a work published as a book at any time. This can include:
* a monograph * an edited collection * a record society volume * an issue of a 17th-century newsbook or other serial * a broadside (not technically a book but classed as a book for convenience)
A book is classed as an edition if:
* it's the first published edition * it's explicitly numbered as a subsequent edition (eg 2nd edition) * it has substantial changes to the text compared to an earlier edition, or if it adds extra text such as a new foreword, preface, introduction, appendix or editorial notes * it adds a new author or editor * it's a translation into a different language * it appears in a different format from another edition, for example if the same work is published as an article and a book * it's a compilation of more than one work that have also been published separately or in different combinations * it's a different issue of a periodical
If none of these apply, a book is classed as a format if it has a different:
* ESTC or USTC number * ISBN (the paperback and hardback versions usually have different ISBNs and should each be classed as separate formats even if the contents are exactly the same) * Amazon ASIN * publisher * date of reprinting * binding or medium (hardback, paperback, ebook)
Edition and format level can be represented by the same page or by different pages. Each edition should have a page. This page can also include a format if there is only one format of that edition. If there is more than one format, they should have separate pages (a query will automatically display them all on the edition's page).
In all of these cases, [[Form:Book]] is used to create and edit the pages. It will ask you to select whether each level is represented by the page you're editing or by another page. You can combine work level into the same page as an edition if there is only one edition published as a book, and no versions in article or manuscript form.
=== Published editions: articles and chapters ===
[[Form:Article|Article]] is used for an edition of a work that was published as:
* a journal or magazine article * a chapter in an edited collection
Every version of an article or chapter should have its own page, even if the text has not changed. This includes legally self-archived versions as well as publishers' versions of record, unless the self-archived version is exactly the same, including the same typography and pagination, as the version of record. Each version of an article is counted as an edition, and there are no formats.
You can combine work level into the same page as an article if it only has one version and that version was published as an article.
=== Printed copies ===
* [[Form:Printed copy|Printed copy]] is for an individual copy of a book edition. For early printed sources, it's especially important to keep track of individual copies because they can have inconsistencies in printing, handwritten marginalia, and their own provenance and ownership histories. Each copy is linked to the GLAM and collection that it is part of, as well as the edition and format. * [[Form:Printed text section|Printed text section]] is a division of a printed text, linked to its parent copy. These divisions can be: ** physical, such as a page or range of pages ** logical, such as a chapter ** arbitrary, such as a passage of a narrative that covers a certain event, even if the author didn't distinguish it in any way (this can be useful for linking accounts of battles, for example)
Copies and sections can have transcripts or summaries of the text added to them if copyright and licence conditions allow.
=== Theses and dissertations ===
* [[Form:Thesis|Thesis]] is used for any thesis or dissertation. They are represented only at one level, not as works and editions. A thesis is not treated as part of the same work as 'the book of the thesis'.
The university associated with a thesis is not represented here as semantic data but can be found by following external links.
== Subject headings ==
[[Form:Subject heading]] is used to create and edit pages that represent general themes rather than specific individual entities. These can be used as values of [[Property:Has main subject]].
== Entity type definitions ==
[[Form:Type definition]] is used to create and edit pages that define types of entity, such as the various types of military unit or manuscript text. These are all used as values of [[Property:Is instance of]].
== Personnel roles ==
[[Form:Personnel role]] is used to create and edit pages that define roles used by [[Form:Agent]] and [[Template:Personnel subobject]] to link agents to organizations that they were members of.
== Categories ==
[[Special:CreateCategory|Create category]] is the easiest way to create a new category as it has a dropdown list to help you select a parent category.
You can also create a category without a form by clicking a red link.
== Create a page without a form ==
Some kinds of pages don't have a form. These include:
* command relationship type definitions * freeform pages about more general historical topics that don't represent an individual entity or source * disambiguation pages * redirects * help pages * non-semantic templates * templates that use semantic properties but not forms, such as copyright status and licence conditions
To create a page without a form, type the page name in the box below and click 'Create page':
<inputbox> type=create break=no </inputbox>
[[Category:Help pages]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the actual start date of an entity if the actual start date is definitely known. It is used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
Values for this property are usually also automatically assigned to [[Property:Has earliest known date]].
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the actual end date of an entity if the actual end date is definitely known. It is used for these entities:
* Units in [[Template:Unit]] * Events in [[Template:Event]] * Command relationships in [[Template:Command relationship subobject]] * Personnel relationships in [[Template:Personnel subobject]] * Locations in [[Template:Location subobject]]
Values for this property are usually also automatically assigned to [[Property:Has latest known date]].
See [[Help:Dates]] for more information on how to enter dates.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents the result of a siege.
The allowed values for this property are listed in [[:Category:Siege results]].

revision.comment: Gavin moved page [[Category:Books (minor editions)]] to [[Category:Book formats]]: renaming edition levels
revision.text:
This category is no longer used to set a default form but has been kept in case it's useful for autocomplete or queries.
[[Category:Groups]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It represents a UIN code from the [http://explore.bl.uk/ British Library Main Catalogue]. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://explore.bl.uk/BLVU1:LSCOP-ALL:$1]]
It is usually used for books published in the UK between 1800 (the end of the ESTC) and 1950 (the start of the BNB). It can also be used for books published after 1950 if they are not yet in the BNB Linked Open Data and do not have an ISBN.
Similar to Wikidata property [[Wikidata:Property:P5199|P5199]] but formatted slightly differently.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a printed or manuscript text is a copy or edition of an edition or work. It is used to link:
* a manuscript copy to a [[work]] * a [[printed copy]] to a [[book format]] * a [[book format]] to a [[book edition]] * a [[book edition]] to a [[work]]
It may also be used to link directly to ancestor levels as well as to immediate parents. To make sure that queries act as expected, it's best to also query for [[Property:Is instance of]] so that you can specify copy, major edition or minor edition.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It represents a unique identifier of an individual [[printed copy]] in a library catalogue. It is not linked to as an external identifier because different library catalogues have different formats for identifiers, and not all have online resolvers. The ID entered here may be different from the URL in [[Property:Has URL]].

<noinclude> This is the "Printed copy" template. It is used by [[Form:Printed copy]] and should not be used separately.
Edit the page to see the template text. </noinclude><includeonly>__NOEDITSECTION__[[Has parent::{{{Part of|Unknown}}}]] > '''{{PAGENAME}}'''

{{#default_form:Printed copy}}
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It represents a person who put an original signature, initials, mark, or seal on a manuscript text. It should only be used if the manuscript contains original signs. If the manuscript is a copy that does not contain the original signs, the value for this property should be [[None]]. If a later copy has a signed certificate of authenticity written on the same paper, the certificate should be represented as a separate child text. If the original of the copy does not survive, you can create a [[Form:Lost manuscript text|Lost manuscript text]] and enter the signatories there.
We do not distinguish between signatures, initials, and marks because the boundaries between these things can be hard to define, and because Signs of Literacy is already collecting data about literacy.

revision.comment: /* Peers */ changed rules for death years
revision.text:
A wiki page name is an identifier for a page within a wiki. This page may be about a named entity (person, place, organization) but strictly speaking, the page name is an identifier for a resource about that entity, not for the entity itself. Where possible, entities are more rigorously identified by linking to external identifiers.
Page names need to balance these things, which sometimes conflict with each other:
* unique * short * informative
This means that the page name should contain enough information for human readers to be able to find what they're looking for, but no more information than is necessary for that.
A page name '''is not''' a full name history of the entity, and does not always have to show the most correct name for that entity.
== Special characters ==
These characters should not be used in page names:
{| class="swordinfotable" !Character !Reasons |- |<nowiki># < > [ ] { } |</nowiki> |These will interfere with wiki markup or HTML markup. |- |& |The ampersand is used for query strings in web addresses. Mediawiki can work around this but we prefer to use 'and' in page names to avoid confusion. |- |: |The colon is used by Mediawiki to signify namespaces. It will work as part of a page name if the prefix is not a namespace, but it can be confusing so we prefer to avoid it even though it is allowed in some other wikis. |- |/ |The forward slash can be used in most page names, and is often needed in archival references, but it should be avoided in page names for Agents or Units because it can cause problems when creating subpages in the Events and Locations namespaces. We now use \ to separate multiple commanders' surnames in the page names for military units. |- |? + = |These have special meaning in web addresses. In wiki page names it might work in practice, but it's better to avoid it . |}
Apart from these, any Latin unicode characters can and should be used to spell names correctly. It's better to transliterate characters from other alphabets into the Latin alphabet. All text added to this site should use UTF-8 character encoding.
== People ==
People can be [[Form:Agent|Agents]] (if they were alive during the British Civil Wars) or [[Form:Author|Authors]] (if they weren't alive at this time and are only included as authors or editors of published texts. Similar naming conventions apply to both.
Surnames should usually come first, followed by a comma, then by forenames and/or initials. The main exception to this rule is for royalty who are commonly known by forenames and either don't have surnames or who are not commonly known by their surname. In this case, the forename comes first, followed by a comma, followed by a royal title. Years of birth and death may be added for disambiguation to compensate for lack of a surname. For example:
* [[Rupert, Prince (1619-1682)]] * [[Charles I, King (1600-1649)]]
For people whose surname comes first, the qualifiers 'junior' or 'senior' may be used if necessary for disambiguation. These come after the forenames, separated by a space, not a comma:
* Balfour, William senior * Balfour, William junior
Further titles (except peerages: see below) may be used after another comma if needed for disambiguation:
* Balfour, William senior, Sir * Balfour, William junior, Major
A military rank may be used directly after surname if the forename is not known:
* Smith, Captain
Any additional disambiguation information usually goes in round brackets after these names.
Years of birth and/or death should only be used if they are absolutely necessary for disambiguation and are certainly known. Often they can be omitted. If they are included, they should be the first thing inside the brackets, before anything else.
Only the most distinctive occupation or other role should be used: the purpose is disambiguation, not to provide a comprehensive description of a person's life.
For modern historians, it's usually only necessary to put 'historian' in brackets. Peerages, knighthoods and other titles can be included. For example:
* [[Russell, Conrad (5th Earl Russell, historian)]] * [[Roy, Ian (historian)]] * [[Hopper, Andrew (historian)]]
It's best if the actual page name uses one or more full forenames unless the historian is much better known by their initials:
* [[Gardiner, S R (historian)]]
But alternative forms with initials can also be redirects. In either case, there are no full points after an initial.
Page names should usually use a person's most well-known name. The original spelling from a historical person's signature is preferred if known, but this won't be enforced rigidly.
The words 'royalist' and 'parliamentarian' should only be used as qualifiers if a person held an actual position in the organization of one side and never for the other, and if these qualifiers are particularly useful for disambiguation or identification of a person.
=== Peers ===
Use only surname, forename, and highest/last title held. Year of death is no longer included:
* [[Devereux, Robert (3rd Earl of Essex)]] * [[Cavendish, William (1st Duke of Newcastle)]]
There should be a redirect for every peer with the title first and the name in brackets:
* [[Essex, Earl of, 3rd (Robert Devereux)]]
There can also be redirects for previous or subsidiary titles but only the highest/last main title should be used in an actual page name.
=== Married surnames ===
Some people take a new surname on marriage. This has traditionally applied to women in Britain but men and nonbinary people might also take a new surname on marriage.
We have no strict rule about whether to use maiden or married surnames where all are known. Use whichever seems most widely used or easy to understand, even if inconsistent. In some cases, a historical widow's maiden name might not be known.
Examples:
* [[Cavendish, Margaret (Duchess of Newcastle)]] uses her married name but was born Margaret Lucas. * [[Howard, Frances (Countess of Essex and Somerset)]] uses her maiden name. Her married names were Devereux and then Carr. * [[Willingham, Anne (nee Eaton)]] uses her married name first but has her maiden name in brackets. * [[Betts, Elizabeath (saddler)]] a widow whose maiden name is currently unknown. * [[Mulligan, Lotte (nee Glow, historian)]] uses her married name first but has her maiden name in brackets.
There can be redirects for other surnames.
If a living historian has a married surname but always uses her maiden name professionally, her married surname should be treated as private and not mentioned anywhere on this site.
=== Transgendered people ===
Living transgendered people's deadnames '''must not''' be mentioned anywhere on this site. They may be mentioned in sources linked to by external identifiers but we can't help that.
== Military units ==
Armies are capitalized and should have as short names as possible. Allegiance can be added after a comma if needed for disambiguation, but can often be left out. Armies can be known by a commander's name, a place name, or both. Sometimes years of existence are needed for disambiguation. Examples:
* [[Essex's Army]] * [[Oxford Army]] * [[Eastern Association Army]] * [[New Model Army]] * [[Army of Covenant (2nd Bishops War)]] * [[Army of Covenant (1643-47)]] * [[Newcastle's Army]]
Units such as regiments, troops and companies were mostly known by the commanding officer's name and did not have official names of their own. In these cases, the page name should have two parts separated by '-'. The first part should be the names of one or more commanding officers. The second part should be the type of unit and any other information needed for disambiguation, such as the army it was in, the side it was on, or the years when it existed.
The first part should put a surname first. If there was only one commanding officer, the forename can be used in the same way as pages for people, but sometimes it can be omitted if the unit or colonel is very well known or there were no similarly named units. If there were multiple commanding officers, multiple surnames can be used, separated by '\' (we no longer use '/' as it can cause confusion when creating subpages in the Events and Locations namespaces). Commanders' names don't have to be in chronological order. It's better to start with the name that seems to be best known or that was used for longest, but this is flexible as cases will vary. Not every commander has to be included in the page name, especially if they only served for a short time. Extra disambiguation information such as ranks, titles or senior/junior can be added if needed.
The second part should start with a unit type, such as 'horse troop' or 'foot regiment'. This is usually in lower case because it's a description, not a proper noun. If the army, allegiance or other parent unit are needed for disambiguation, the can go next after a comma. Army names should be capitalized but regiment names shouldn't. New Model Army units will probably always have 'New Model Army' in the page name, and will be treated as separate units from their predecessors. Any other disambiguation information, such as years active, can go in brackets.
Examples:
* [[Cromwell\Vermuyden\Disbrowe - horse regiment, New Model Army]] * Balfour, William senior, Sir - horse troop, Essex's Army * Balfour, William junior, Major - horse troop, Essex's Army * Cromwell\St John\Cooper - horse troop * Cromwell, Oliver junior - horse troop, Eastern Association * Long, Walter - horse troop (1642) * Long, Walter - horse troop (1643)
There should be a redirect for every commanding officer. These should start with surname then forename like person pages. Names of other commanding officers should be added in brackets only if they are absolutely necessary for disambiguation. For example, these redirect to [[Cromwell\Vermuyden\Disbrowe - horse regiment, New Model Army]]:
* [[Vermuyden, Bartholomew - horse regiment, New Model Army]] * [[Disbrowe, John - horse regiment, New Model Army]]
== Households ==
A unit page that represents a household should usually start with the page name of the head of household followed by '- household'. For example:
* [[Willingham, George (-1651, London merchant) - household]]
== Places ==
Counties of England, Scotland and Wales should usually have the English name used by the [http://www.county-borders.co.uk/ Historic Counties Standard] followed by a comma then the country name:
* [[Essex, England]] * [[Denbighshire, Wales]] * [[East Lothian, Scotland]]
There should be a redirect for:
* alternative English names shown in the Historic Counties Standard * Welsh language names of Welsh counties. Most are shown in the Historic Counties Standard. Some alternatives come from Wikipedia. Country suffix should be ', Cymru'. * Gaelic names of Scottish counties. These are mostly taken from [https://www.ainmean-aite.scot/ Ainmean-Àite na h-Alba]. A few that are not explicitly given there are taken from Wikipedia or other sources. Country suffix should be ', Alba'. * we don't yet have a source for Scots names of Scottish counties where these differ from English names.
Settlements should have name, county at large and country:
* [[Colchester, Essex, England]] * [[Coggeshall, Essex, England]]
Except that county should be omitted if the county name is taken from and very close to a city name. For example, 'Gloucester, England' not 'Gloucester, Gloucestershire, England'.
Places in Lincolnshire and Yorkshire should also be qualified by the name of the riding, even if the page name would be unique without it:
* [[Grimsby, Lindsey, Lincolnshire, England]] * [[Doncaster, West Riding, Yorkshire, England]]
May need further disambiguation if two places have same name in same county.
Spellings of settlement names should usually be the English names used by Ordnance Survey data, unless there is a good reason to use an older name. Hyphens between words are replaced by spaces in page names, for example, 'Stratford upon Avon', not 'Stratford-upon-Avon'. There should be redirects for versions with hyphens. This rule does not apply to English names of settlements in Scotland where the hyphen is used to add a suffix such as -head or -side.
There should be redirects for Welsh and Gaelic names if shown in Ordnance Survey data, or if they can easily be imported from other sources. [This rule may need changing after more detailed examination of OS data.] Welsh Language Commissioner has a [http://www.comisiynyddygymraeg.cymru/English/Commissioner/PlaceNames/Pages/Download.aspx CSV file of Welsh places names], linked to OS IDs, available under OGL.
Durham is a special case. Use:
* for the settlement page: [[Durham (settlement), England]] * for the county page: [[Durham (county), England]] * suffix for pages for other places in the county: County Durham, England
Rural parishes should usually be settlement name followed by parish:
* [[Great Missenden parish, Buckinghamshire, England]] * Hawerby cum Beesby parish, Lincolnshire, England
Similarly, subunits should be settlement name + chapelry/township/hamlet/whatever.
But urban parishes should be disambiguated by saint's name:
* St Botolph Aldgate parish, London, England
Parish churches should have pages with same names as parishes but with 'church' instead of 'parish':
* Earls Colne church, Essex, England * St Botolph Aldgate church, London, England
St is usually preferred to Saint as this style is used by Ordnance Survey data for most place names.
But where a parish name combines more than one settlement, it's better to name the church only after the settlement where it actually is (if this is known), not after the whole parish. For example, 'Hawerby church, Lincolnshire, England' not 'Hawerby cum Beesby church, Lincolnshire, England'.
Other buildings should usually have the name of the building and the name of the settlement they are in or near, unless the settlement name already appears in the building name (this often happens with castles). Urban buildings should also have the street if it's known and useful. Oxford and Cambridge colleges should have Address pages to represent the buildings, and these should be qualified with ' buildings' at the end of the page name to disambiguate them from Unit pages that represent the college as an organization.
Boroughs and corporate counties should be separate entities from settlements in them:
* Colchester borough, England * [[Lincoln city, England]] * [[London city, England]]
Separate entities for county and borough jurisdictions:
* Essex commission of the peace, England * [[Essex shrievalty, England]] * Essex lieutenancy, England * [[Essex constituency, England]] * [[Colchester constituency, Essex, England]] * Lincolnshire commission of the peace, England * Lincoln commission of the peace, England
Ecclesiastical units:
* Lincoln diocese, England * Lincoln archdeaconry, England * Dorchester deanery, England * Edinburgh synod, Scotland * Peebles presbytery, Scotland
Names for these are initially taken from Ecton's ''Liber Valorum'' for England and Wales, or ''Fasti Ecclesiae Scoticanae'' for Scotland but can be improved from other sources.
== Events ==
=== Combat events ===
Start with place name, then date and event type in round brackets. For events that took place in one day, use the full date including calendar. Sieges can often just use the year but if the same place was besieged more than once in a year, the date can be expanded as much as is needed for disambiguation. Event type can include battle, skirmish, siege, assault, sally, storming or anything else that seems appropriate. It doesn't have to match the semantic data. The distinction between battles and skirmishes isn't rigid.
* [[Edgehill (1642-10-23 JL, battle)]] * [[Gloucester (1643, siege)]]
=== Meetings ===
Start with the name of the organization that held the meeting, then full date including calendar in round brackets. For example:
* [[Council of War, Essex's Army (1644-06-19 JL)]] * [[House of Commons, Short Parliament (1640-04-13 JL)]] * [[House of Lords, Short Parliament (1640-05-05 JL)]]
== Manuscripts and collections ==
Should start with GLAM name followed by comma. [[The National Archives of the UK (TNA)]] is abbreviated to TNA, but most other GLAMs are not abbreviated:
* TNA, * British Library, * Bodleian Library,
Then full catalogue reference eg for pieces/volumes:
* British Library, Add MS 18980 * TNA, SP 28/131/3 * Bodleian Library, MS Tanner 62
For lower collection levels, individual texts, and sections, include folio numbers where necessary:
* British Library, Add MS 18980, f. 1 * TNA, SP 28/131/3, f. 1 * Bodleian Library, MS Tanner 62, f. 1
If individual documents in a box don't have official item numbers, the page name can have ordinal numbers in brackets. For example:
* TNA, SP 28/151 (2nd item)
In this case, the orderable reference would be 'SP 28/151' and citable reference would be 'SP 28/151 unfol.'.
We may use the same approach where documents don't have folio numbers.
These will all need default sort string setting (this can be done in editing form) otherwise they won't sort in a sensible order. In the sort string, components should be separated by spaces, not commas or slashes. Numbers should be zero filled to the highest number of digits expected in that context.
For example, pieces in [[TNA, SP 28]] can have up to 3 digits, so the sort string for [[TNA, SP 28/4]] is 'TNA SP 28 004'.
== Printed sources ==
If more than one level (work, edition, format) is combined into the same page, that page should usually use the naming conventions for edition level. If another edition is added later, the edition page should stay as it is and a new page should be created for work level.
=== Works ===
Author surnames and short title will usually do. Use - to separate authors from title because commas can be used in title and italics can't be used in a page name.
* Wanklyn and Jones - Military History * Cruso - Military Instructions * Robinson - Horses, People and Parliament
=== Book editions ===
Usually as work title but qualified by edition (which can be either an ordinal number or the name of an editor) and year of first publication in brackets:
* Wanklyn and Jones - Military History (1st edition, 2005) * Cruso - Military Instructions (1st edition, 1632) * Cruso - Military Instructions (2nd edition, 1644) * Cruso - Military Instructions (Young edition, 1972)
=== Book formats ===
Otherwise similar to edition but also qualified by format and year that this format was published (which is not necessarily the year the edition was first published). Publisher can also be added if different formats were published by different publishers. For example:
* Wanklyn and Jones - Military History (1st edition, hardback, 2005) * Robinson - Horses, People and Parliament (1st edition, Ashgate hardback, 2012) * Robinson - Horses, People and Parliament (1st edition, Routledge paperback, 2017)
If the format has an [[Property:Has_ESTC_number|ESTC number]], then this should go at the end of the bracketed part of the page name. For example:
* Cruso - Military Instructions (1st edition, 1632, ESTC S121933)
=== Book copies ===
Should usually use holding GLAM, and unique identifier from library catalogue:
* British Library, E.69(10)
A version at the Internet Archive can count as a copy in its own right if the identity of the physical copy that it was scanned from is unknown or irrelevant. For 19th-century and later editions, the identity of the copy doesn't usually matter, although there may be exceptional cases where it does.
For Internet Archive copies, use 'Internet Archive, ' followed by the unique ID from the URL:
* [[Internet Archive, diarymarchesroy00librgoog]]
=== Journals/serials ===
Journals use full current names but omit 'The' from start. Redirects can be used to help find journals under old titles, but these should not be used as property values.
Examples:
* [[British Journal for Military History]] * [[War in History]]
Series of monographs should be in the form 'Series title (Publisher)'. More than one publisher can be included in the brackets if the series has changed publisher. There should also be redirects in the form 'Publisher - Series title' for every publisher of a series, even if there is only one.
Example:
* [[Century of the Soldier (Helion)]]
=== Articles ===
Journal article version of record:
* Author surname ' - ' abbreviated title (journal, publication year)
Journal names are usually full but can be abbreviated if the abbreviation is well known or the full title is very long.
Journal article self-archived version:
* Author surname ' - ' abbreviated title (repository)
Chapter in collection:
* Author surname ' - ' abbreviated title (abbreviated title of collection, publication year)
=== Theses ===
Author's surname - short title (thesis, year of completion)
For example:
* [[Robinson - Horse Supply (thesis, 2001)]]
== Disambiguation pages ==
A new page created as a disambiguation page should always end with ' (disambiguation)'. The rest of the title should be as short as possible.
Pages that are changed to disambiguation pages after they were created as content pages or redirects should keep the same name.
[[Category:Help pages]]

This is the "Printed text section" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Printed text section}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Printed text sections]]. __NOTOC__ = Structured data = {{{for template|Printed text section}}} {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea|cols=45}}} |- ! Parent text or section: | {{{field|Part of|values from category=Autocomplete printed section parents|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Ancestor copy: | {{{field|Ancestor copy|values from category=Printed copies|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Main subject: | {{{field|Main subject|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Autocomplete subjects}}} |- ! Mentions: | {{{field|Mentions|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Autocomplete subjects}}} |- ! Earliest date covered: | {{{field|Earliest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Latest date covered: | {{{field|Latest date covered|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} == Sections == {{{field|Query for sections|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for child sections. You should only add the query if you know that child sections exist or expect them to exist soon. {{{end template}}} = Any other information = You can use this free text area to add any introductory text or other information. {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} = Transcript = If copyright and licence conditions allow, you can use this free text area to add a transcript, summary or extracts of the text. Before adding text, please copy this code into the text area if it isn't already there: 
{{Intro|PUT INTRODUCTORY TEXT HERE}}
PUT TRANSCRIBED TEXT HERE
{{End of transcript}}
And replace 'PUT INTRODUCTORY TEXT HERE' with any introductory text that is needed. For more help, see [[Help:Transcription conventions#Introductory text]] {{{section|Transcript|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}
