{{#default_form:Agent}} It represents people and animals of other species who were alive during the British Civil Wars.
For people who were not alive during the British Civil Wars and are only included as authors or editors of published works, see [[:Category:Authors]].
[[Category:Default form categories]]

__TOC__ == Cookies ==
This site runs on MediaWiki, which automatically tries to set cookies for all visitors. These cookies are only used internally by the software and do not provide any information to the site owner or any third parties.
In practice, cookies are only important if you want to register and log in to edit pages (registration is currently closed but will be opened to the public in future). If you do not want cookies and never want to log in, you can safely block cookies from 'www.bytheswordlinked.uk'. If you don't know how to block cookies, check your browser's documentation.
== Publishing information about living people ==
This project includes pages for living authors. These pages should only include information that is already publicly available and not restricted by another organization's privacy policy (for example, the GRO does not allow details of living people from birth/marriage/death certificates to be published even though the certificates themselves are available to the public).
We also put further restrictions on some private information, even if it is already available to the public elsewhere:
* transgendered people's deadnames must never be used anywhere on this site. * if a person has changed their surname on marriage or for some other reason, only surnames that they use, or have used, professionally should be mentioned on this site. Surnames that they have never used professionally are treated as private and not mentioned here.
== Private data about registered users ==
Registration is currently closed, but in future registration and editing will be made public. When this happens, you will need to supply and validate an e-mail address in order to register. This address will not be made public or shared with third parties. After your account has been validated, you can delete your e-mail address if you don't want it stored. If you choose to keep your e-mail address stored with your account, you can opt in to receive e-mails from site admins and other users.
Your IP address may be stored by the software but will not be published. MediaWiki only displays IP addresses for anonymous edits, and anonymous editing will not be allowed on this site.
No other information about you will be stored or published except what you choose to publish on your user page.
This site uses cookies. You can block them if you never want to log in. See [[Project:Privacy policy|Privacy policy]] for more information.

This is an experimental project to make a new finding aid and reference work about the British Civil Wars using Linked Open Data.
The project is run by Dr Gavin Robinson. You can [http://www.drgavinrobinson.uk/contact.html contact me through my website].
For more information about this project, see the [https://bytheswordlinked.hcommons.org/ project blog], especially the [https://bytheswordlinked.hcommons.org/2019/02/26/introduction/ introduction post].

Help pages on this wiki are listed in [[:Category:Help pages]].
This site runs on MediaWiki (like Wikipedia) with Semantic MediaWiki (like Marine Lives). You can get lots of help from the manuals for the software:
* [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:Contents MediaWiki manual] * [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:User_manual Semantic MediaWiki manual]
[[Project:Known issues|Known issues]] lists problems that we know about but haven't fixed yet.

This includes battles, sieges and similar, along with redirects for alternate names.
You can also seem them on a map at [[map of combat events]].
Actual page names are added automatically by [[Template:Event]]. Redirects need to be added manually.
[[Category:Groups]]

For reference, this page contains information about caches used by the wiki and server.
__TOC__
== PHP code ==
opcache enabled in Cpanel by default. Doesn't need any setup.
== MediaWiki caches ==
MediaWiki and Semantic MediaWiki have these caches, which can be set up by the following variables in LocalSettings:
{|class="wikitable" |- !Variable !Default !Current !Notes |- | [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgCachePages $wgCachePages] | TRUE | TRUE | Allows browsers to cache pages locally |- | [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgMainCacheType $wgMainCacheType] | CACHE_NONE | CACHE_NONE | |- | [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgParserCacheType $wgParserCacheType] | CACHE_ANYTHING | CACHE_NONE | |- | [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:$wgMessageCacheType $wgMessageCacheType] | CACHE_ANYTHING | CACHE_NONE | |- | [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:$smwgMainCacheType $smwgMainCacheType] | CACHE_ANYTHING | CACHE_NONE | |- | [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:$smwgValueLookupCacheType $smwgValueLookupCacheType] | CACHE_NONE | CACHE_NONE | Experimental |- | [https://www.semantic-mediawiki.org/wiki/Help:$smwgQueryResultCacheType $smwgQueryResultCacheType] | CACHE_NONE | CACHE_NONE | Experimental |}
While there is only one registered user and editor, all MediaWiki caches are disabled to make sure that pages update as quickly as possible. Users who are not logged in will often be served pages from the Litespeed Cache (see below).
For logged in users, inline query results will update as soon as the job queue has cleared. Users who are not logged in will get out of date version from Litespeed cache until cached version expires or whole cache is manually purged by an admin.
== Web cache ==
(Not the same thing as MediaWiki's HTML cache.)
No web cache currently used. This server has LiteSpeed but the MediaWiki LiteSpeed cache extension has been removed because it was causing some problems and is not well integrated with MediaWiki.
In future this site will need to be moved to a different server with a Varnish cache, but for now we can manage without a web cache.
== Special:Ask ==
It looks like query results at [[Special:Ask]] will never be cached by anything. This should mean that results will always be up to date, but server will have to run the query every time the page loads.

revision.comment: /* Outstanding issues */ limitations of NOT operator in queries
revision.text:
__TOC__
== Outstanding issues ==
These problems have been found during testing and not yet solved:
* the query language apparently has no way to exclude pages from query results according to specified criteria because the NOT operator finds all pages that have a property value that is not the one specified, and this is often useless for our purposes. This means that source queries for some armies will be swamped with collections of pay warrants. These warrants can be queried for separately but can't be excluded from a query for all other sources. * there may be a bug in [[Special:Export]] that truncates the text of some pages. It is not yet known whether this also affects dumpBackup.php which is used to export to Github. * timeline and eventline result formats always use Gregorian calendar, which puts some events in the wrong month. This means there is currently no use case for the Semantic Result Format extension, so it could probably be removed. * when editing with a form then previewing, error message 'Some parts of the form did not reach the server' always appears. Edits are not lost and can be saved, but if header tabs are used in the form, these no longer appear on the form after preview. Seems to be connected with [https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T254647 this bug] that has not yet been fixed. * pages from namespaces other than Main and Special do not appear in search suggestions. This is a known bug in Title Key that has not yet been patched, but only seems to occur here since upgrade from Mediawiki 1.31 to 1.35. * sometimes trying to save an edit gives 403 forbidden error. Probably to do with [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/ModSecurity mod_security] but not clear what it objects to. May be semi-colons which make text look like PHP code when it isn't. These semi-colons may have been down to typos in templates which have now been fixed, but there may be cases in future where the error is triggered again. * where a template generates an inline link to a query based on the page name, this mostly works but on at least one page it generated a link with the wrong query signature. This means that the query does nothing (doesn't even return 'No results'). Not clear how this happened as the template worked correctly on other pages. * page names containing non-ASCII accented characters seem to sort in a strange order in categories. Need to find out what the correct order is in the relevant languages and set sort keys if necessary. * when editing a page using a form, autocomplete suggestions match any characters and are sorted in alphabetical order without prioritising exact matches or matches at the start of the page name. This is inconvenient when linking to a county because every place name in that county will match, and many will come before the county itself. Turning off character matching would also disable accent folding. * sometimes embedded maps don't load and just display as grey. Refreshing the page seems to fix this. Not clear if this is a problem with Maps extension or OpenStreetMap. Not seen since Maps extension upgraded to 7.18 but more testing needed. * leaflet input in forms works if it's on the first header tab but not on the second. For now, leaflet inputs are kept on the first tab but a better solution will be needed in future. * leaflet input ignores starting bounds. Not clear if this has really been implemented for leaflet or only for Google maps. Needs testing in Page Forms 4.9.4 as may have been fixed. * the default skin we are using has not yet been thoroughly tested for accessibility by this project's standards. It could contain obstacles such as overcomplicated layouts, unnecessary javascript or other problems. For now, some accessibility problems are likely to have been fixed by changing the default skin to Monobook, but this could also have introduced other problems. * TitleKey extension is known to break Visual Editor so we can't use both at once. * using [[Special:ReplaceText]] to update incoming links after moving a page will go wrong if the page name to be changed is a substring of another page name.
== Resolved issues ==
* [[Cheshire, England]] had been overwritten by a redirect. This has now been corrected. * default skin is now Monobook, not Vector. This has the following effects: ** pages load faster and have less unnecessary javascript ** edit tabs and search box don't move after page loads ** removes a menu that was difficult to access with the keyboard * now using free text section instead of template for transcripts of texts, and using wiki templates instead of XML tags to mark up features in transcripts. This fixes these problems: ** editing some pages with form caused timeout and CPU spike ** table markup inside transcripts had to use magic word instead of pipe ** Page Forms sometimes changed angle brackets to entity references, which stopped XML tags from being parsed properly ** if in future we use Visual Editor, custom XML tags would not be compatible * upgraded Page Forms extension to 4.9.4. This fixes these problems: ** pages edited with a form had every template parameter in the source code even if no value had been entered, which stopped default values in templates from taking effect. ** leaflet input didn't allow manually editing coordinates or pasting coordinates from elsewhere. * <nowiki><name>, <date> and <gap></nowiki> tags can now be used inside footnotes if you use the optional attribute display="inline", which stops these tags from generating their own footnotes. * search suggestions now have accent folding. This means that if you type an ASCII character such as e suggestions will also match accented versions. * creating Events and Location pages via red link from Unit or Agent pages didn't work if page name included an apostrophe (and possibly other special characters). Target of #formlink should use <nowiki>{{PAGENAMEE}}</nowiki> to URL encode the page name, but URL encoding should NOT be used in #ifexists or normal wikilinks. Still need to investigate whether this problem affects #formredlink * LiteSpeed cache extension has been removed because it isn't well integrated with MediaWiki and was causing some other problems. This resolves these issues: ** map markers not displaying properly. Still happened with Maps 7.4.1. When LiteSpeed cache is enabled, Maps 7.18 has even worse problems: some map tiles don't display and no markers display. ** pages not purged from cache unless manually edited or transcluded template edited ** logged-in users served cached version of page that makes it look like they're not logged in * if [[Special:WantedPages]] is out of date but no jobs in queue, use [https://www.mediawiki.org/wiki/Manual:UpdateSpecialPages.php updateSpecialPages.php] maintenance script. * pages imported en masse by command line script are not autopatrolled. Solutions: ** adding --username-prefix="" to import command stops this problem as imports will be credited to correct user, including that user's autopatrol rights. In practice, when doing it like this, imported pages don't appear in recent changes even after rebuild. ** if pages have already been flagged as unpatrolled, this can be changed directly in the database through PHPMyAdmin: UPDATE `recentchanges` SET rc_patrolled = 2 WHERE rc_patrolled = 0 [2 means autopatrolled, 1 means manually patrolled, 0 means unpatrolled] ** (never rebuild recent changes after import. Doing this will reflag pages as unpatrolled if they have been imported with a user prefix. This will happen again even if they have been set to patrolled directly in the database as above.) ** (disabling patrolling in local settings is not an option as it would need to be turned on again when the wiki is opened up to other editors.) * ByTheSwordLinkedTags extension has been removed as it wasn't really necessary. * 'Show preview' should now work when editing with form but needs further testing to confirm. (This was caused by a div that was automatically inserted into forms but has now been manually removed.) * / characters in unit page names have been replaced by \ in case / causes problems with subpage names in Locations and Events namespaces. * links between counties and associations that were accidentally deleted have been added back. * [[Special:Ask]] can now display and export up to 2,000 query results at once (was previously set to 500). * links to Battlefields Trust website that were accidentally deleted have been added back. * mod_security doesn't allow inline CSS. To get custom styling, add a class to a div or span tag and define that class in [[Mediawiki:Common.css]]. * recently imported English settlements now have missing queries for sources and personnel.
== Quirks ==
These are minor problems that can be worked around, or things that have to be done a certain way. Some of these are irrelevant to most users because they only affect the main templates, but admins need to be reminded.
* semantic tags can't be nested in other semantic tags. * semantic text properties can't contain wikilinks or footnotes. * categories entered using autocomplete in forms can have sort key added but needs to use magic word instead of pipe because they are inside a template parameter. * all tags that use template parameters must use the parser function #tag and not raw XML tags to ensure that everything is parsed in the correct order. * when linking to a map query, result format should be 'leaflet' and there '''should not''' be a space after = ** this works: format=leaflet ** this doesn't work: format = leaflet * date parameters should pass a single space, not an empty string, as default value. This default value can be passed straight to #set without any sanity checks. Passing an empty string causes problems. * interwiki links to Marine Lives need to be set up manually after a new install (this may include upgrades to a new Mediawiki version). * in forms, free text sections must always go '''after''' all templates otherwise things go wrong. * use multiple assignments instead of subproperties otherwise it's difficult to display subproperty values in query results. * when using #ask parser function to make inline queries, limit=0 creates a link to the query without running it or saying whether there are any results, limit=-1 stops the query from working at all and should never be used. This does not match the documentation. * if Litespeed cache needs to be tried again, the version at Mediawiki extensions website is out of date. Get the latest version from [https://github.com/litespeedtech/lscache_mediawiki/ Github]. * new version of Title Key extension doesn't work here at all. Keep using existing version as long as possible. This includes hacks for accent folding and changing SLAVE to REPLICA which were not originally in the shipped code. NB to update database table after imports, use 'php extensions/TitleKey/rebuildTitleKeys.php' from mw directory. This is different from instructions for newer versions. * 'show on select' doesn't work with combobox inputs.

This is a parent category to contain subcategories that group together instances of entities in ways that are not possible or convenient using existing semantic data. For example, lists of counties.
[[Category:Categories]]

This category is used to keep track of pages in the Main namespace that contain only free text and are not edited through forms and templates. Pages in the Help namespace should always be added to to [[:Category:Help pages]] instead of this category.
[[Category:Categories]]

This is a parent category for subcategories that list groups of counties. You should not add pages directly to this category.
[[Category:Groups]]

This category lists the counties of all the nations of Great Britain (not Ireland), including all shires and corporate counties. It can also include subdivisions of counties and other anomalous areas that had some characteristics of a county. Redirects for alternative English names can be categorized using this category. Kernow is also included for Cornwall, but other Celtic language names are listed in different categories:
* [[:Category:Counties of Scotland by Gaelic name]] * [[:Category:Counties of Wales by Welsh name]]
[[Category:Counties]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It refers to ID numbers at the [https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/ Scotland, Scandinavia and Northern European Biographical Database (SSNE)]. The value entered should be the number only. This is found at:
* the end of the URL of a person's page, such as <nowiki>https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/item.php?id=</nowiki>'''8049''' * in square brackets at the top of a person's page after their name, such as <nowiki>[SSNE 8049]</nowiki>
It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://arts.st-andrews.ac.uk/history/ssne/item.php?id=$1]]

This is the "Event" form. To create a page with this form, enter the page name below; if a page with that name already exists, you will be sent to a form to edit that page. {{#forminput:form=Event}} Existing pages that use this form are listed in [[:Category:Events]]. You can also see [[combat event]]s on a map at [[map of combat events]]. __NOTOC__ {{{for template|Event}}} = Structured data = == Basic data == {| class="formtable" |- ! Description: | {{{field|Description|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Disambiguation text: | {{{field|Disambiguation|input type=textarea}}} |- ! Type: | {{{field|Type|input type=dropdown|values from category=Event types}}} |- ! Location: | {{{field|Location|list|delimiter=;|values from category=Addresses|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! WGS84 coordinates: | [[#Coordinates|Use map below]] (only for combat events) |- ! Wikidata ID: | {{{field|Wikidata ID|input type=text}}} |- ! Categories: | {{{field|Categories|list|delimiter=;|values from namespace=Category|input type=tokens|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |- ! Sort key: | {{{field|Sort by|input type=text}}} |} Sort key should be left blank unless page name contains accented characters, in which case sort key should be page name but with accented characters replaced by non-accented ASCII characters. == Dates == This event happened on: {{{field|Days|values=one day,multiple days|input type=dropdown|show on select=one day=>one-day;multiple days=>mult-days}}}
Enter the date of this event below {| class="formtable" |- ! Date: | {{{field|Single date|input type=text|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL|size=13|maxlength=13}}} |}
Enter the start and end date below, and use the dropdown lists to select whether the date is definite or the earliest/latest known: {| class="formtable" |- | {{{field|Start date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite start date,earliest known date|default=definite start date}}} | {{{field|Start date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |- | {{{field|End date type|input type=dropdown|values=definite end date,latest known date|default=definite end date}}} | {{{field|End date|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}} |}
== Result == If this was a combat event which was wholly the capture, or attempted capture, of a building or settlement, please enter the result here. Otherwise leave blank. {{{field|Result|input type=dropdown|values from category=Siege results}}} == Related events == {| class="formtable" |- ! Parent event: | {{{field|Parent|values from category=Events|input type=text with autocomplete|placeholder=Start typing for autocomplete suggestions}}} |} {{{field|Query for child events|input type=checkbox}}} Tick this box to add a query for events that were part of this event. You should only add the query if you know that this event has child events. == Coordinates == You can use the map below to add or change the coordinates for this event if it is a combat event (leave blank for other types of event). Just zoom the map in to the right area and double click on the map. The coordinates of the point where you double click will be recorded in the box. (You can't manually edit the coordinates in the box or paste in coordinates from somewhere else because this feature isn't working properly.) {{{field|WGS84|input type=leaflet|starting bounds=48.66291, -11.91943;61.14394, 0.73682}}} =Query for sources= {{{field|Override query|input type=checkbox|show on select=new-query}}} A standard query for sources will be inserted automatically. If you need to change this query, check the box.
You can override the standard query using this text area. This could be a different query, more than one query, or some text explaining why a query isn't appropriate. {{{field|Source query|input type=textarea|rows=20}}} For reference, the code for the standard query is shown below. You can copy this into the text area above and adapt it if you need to. 
{{#ask:
[[Relates to::{{PAGENAME}}]]
| ?Has description=Description
| limit = 20
| default = No linked sources found.
}}
{{{end template}}} =Links to sources= You can use the text area below to create manual links to sources. These can be: * external links to pages on other websites. * internal links to pages on this wiki if semantic links that will show up in a query aren't appropriate. For example, if this entity isn't the main subject of a book and you need to cite a page number here. {{{section|Links to sources|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} =Any other info= {{{section|Any other information|level=2|rows=20|hide if empty}}} {{{standard input|summary}}} {{{standard input|minor edit}}} {{{standard input|watch}}} {{{standard input|save}}} {{{standard input|preview}}} {{{standard input|changes}}} {{{standard input|cancel}}}

== Using material from this site ==
All text and semantic data on this site (apart from embedded maps, see below) is made available under a [https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0/ Creative Commons Attribution Share Alike licence] (CC-BY-SA). This means that you are free to copy, use, adapt, and republish any text or data for any purpose, including commercial use, provided that you acknowledge this site as the source and that if you publish a derivative work, it must be released under exactly the same licence. A link to this site will be sufficient acknowledgement. If the material comes from only one page, it's best to link directly to that page. If it comes from more than one page, a link to the main page of the site will be enough.
Note that some material here is reused from other sources and may be under its own Creative Commons licence or [http://www.nationalarchives.gov.uk/doc/open-government-licence/version/3/ Open Government Licence] (OGL). In these cases, the other copyright holders should be acknowledged as well as this site. This applies to pages that have a statement acknowledging copyright, and to pages that represent a manuscript text that has its own copyright and licence conditions stated as part of its metadata.
Because this site's licence now has a Share Alike condition, you must not change the licence conditions of derivative works.
=== Maps ===
Embedded maps are from [https://www.openstreetmap.org/ OpenStreetMap]. They have their own copyright and licence conditions which you can find by clicking the link in the bottom right corner of each map.
== Adding material to this site ==
In order to be published on this site, text or data must be:
* '''either''' released under a valid licence that is compatible with CC-BY-SA. Valid means that it must be licensed by someone who has the legal right to do so. Compatible usually means CC0, CC-BY, CC-BY-SA or OGL. * '''or''' free from all possible restrictions. This includes contracts and terms of use as well as intellectual property rights. To meet this condition: ** copyright and database right must have expired or never subsisted in the first place. This includes new copyrights in a derivative work that includes editorial changes to a work that is out of copyright in its original version. ** there must not be any claims to own intellectual property in the material, even if these claims are potentially dubious or actually being disputed. We prefer to be cautious in these cases in order to avoid conflict. ** the material must not be copied from an electronic resource whose terms of use restrict reuse, even if the material itself is out of copyright. ** there must not be any other contract restricting reuse of the material. This includes agreements with archives for permission to copy physical documents from their holdings. ** absence of a licence or copyright statement '''does not''' imply that a work is free of restrictions.
== Linking to other sites ==
We allow external links to any other sites that publish material legally, even if their conditions do not allow the material to be republished here. If a site's terms of use ban incoming links or say that incoming links require permission, we won't usually link to them even though such terms are not likely to be legally enforceable.
We do not allow links to sites that publish material illegally. This especially means sites such as Sci-Hub, whose main purpose is to share infringing copies of articles. It also includes Academia.edu because some self-archived articles there may breach the authors' publishing contracts and infringe rights that have been exclusively licensed to the publisher. [https://hcommons.org/ Humanities Commons] is a much better place to self-archive articles because it's non-commercial, allows you to reserve all rights, and gives the self-archived version its own DOI.
The Internet Archive is treated on a case by case basis: if a copy published there infringes copyright according to UK law, it must not be linked to from here, but this does not affect links to other Internet Archive material that is out of copyright. (This principle can't be applied to Academia.edu because we can't know the terms of each relevant publishing contract.)
== Jurisdiction ==
This site is hosted in the UK and is governed by UK copyright law. Our policies are based on UK copyright law. Accessing this site or reusing material from it may (or may not) infringe copyright in other jurisdictions.

<includeonly>This form lets you search for events (such as [[combat event]]s or [[meeting]]s) by the dates when they happened.

You can enter a single date to find events that were in progress on that date, or you can enter two dates to find events that happened on any days within the range.

See [[Help:Dates]] for more information about how to enter dates.

Enter a single date, or the first date of a range in this box:

{{{for template|Search events by date}}}

{{{field|FromDate|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL|mandatory}}}

Optionally, if you want to search for a range of dates, enter the last date in this box (to search for a single date, leave this box blank):

{{{field|ToDate|input type=text|size=13|maxlength=13|placeholder=YYYY-MM-DD JL}}}

Optionally, you can limit the search to one type of event by selecting it from the list below (leave this blank to search for all types of event):

{{#default_form:Type definition}}
[[Category:Default form categories]]

This category contains sub-categories that are used to flag pages that need something doing to them.
[[Category:Categories]]

These authors do not currently have a Wikidata ID. This is usually because a Wikidata item doesn't exist for them, although one may have been created since we last checked. Ideally these authors need to be linked to Wikidata, and a new item created for them if necessary, but this might not be straightforward. Some authors in this category can't be positively identified, and some might not have any unambiguous external identifiers that can be used to create a Wikidata item.
[[Category:To do]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It is used to link to copies of articles at [https://www.jstor.org/ JSTOR]. These copies are treated as the same as the version of record and are not represented by a separate wiki page.
Only the article ID should be entered in this field. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::https://www.jstor.org/stable/$1]]

This category contains subcategories for pages and redirects in specific languages other than English.
[[Category:Categories]]

revision.comment: /* Places and administrative areas */ updated link to cathedrals
revision.text:
This page gives an overview of the progress of this project.
[[:Category:Default form categories]] lists subcategories for each basic entity type and shows the total number of pages of each type.
== Data structures ==
As of September 2021, data structures are not expected to change much in future.
For the current state of the data structures, see:
* [[Help:Create a page]] for a brief overview of the different types. * [[Help:Data structures]] for a more detailed look at the properties and how they're used for each type. * [[Special:Properties]] for a list of all semantic properties. Each property page gives more details of what it means and how it's used. * [[:Category:Type definitions]] for values that can be used for [[Property:Is instance of]]. More need to be added, especially for military units. * [[:Category:Property values]] for other property values that are not instances or classes of entities. Many more need to be added, especially military ranks.
== Places and administrative areas ==
* [[:Category:Addresses]] lists all settlements, buildings, streets, islands, bridges and land that currently have pages. This is now nearly 19,000 pages. * [[:Category:Areas]] lists all administrative areas such as counties. * we have pages for all [[Cathedral]]s in England and Wales. * you can drill down from [[Church of England]] to find all provinces, dioceses, archdeaconries and rural deaneries in England and Wales. We only have parishes for London, Westminster and Southwark. There are pages for some but not all peculiar jurisdictions.
=== Scotland ===
[[Scotland]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
* [[:Category:Counties of Scotland]] lists all shires of Scotland by their English names, including some alternate names. * [[:Category:Counties of Scotland by Gaelic name]] lists all shires of Scotland by their Gaelic names. * [[:Category:Constituencies of the Parliament of Scotland]] lists 99 (believed to be all) shire and burgh constituencies. * we have pages for around 6,000 populated places, mostly derived from Ordnance Survey data. You can find individual places using the search box, or follow the links from county pages to query for all settlements in that county. * 165 pages for Scottish islands: ** [[Map of Scottish islands]] ** [[Concept:Scottish islands|List of Scottish islands]]
=== England ===
[[England]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
We now have a page for every:
* county: [[:Category:Counties of England]] lists all [[county at large|shires]] and probably all [[county of itself|corporate counties]], plus a few large divisions of counties and other areas that have special status. * [[National Character Area (England)]]. * [[shrievalty]]. These are jurisdictions of [[sheriff]]s and are always represented separately from the county or city they are named after. * parliamentary constituency: listed in [[:Category:Constituencies of the Parliament of England and Wales]].
We now have over 12,000 [[settlement]]s in England. At least 1,000 are still missing. You can find an individual settlement using the search box, or follow the links from county pages to query for all settlements in that county.
==== London ====
London, Westminster and Southwark now have:
* probably all parishes and churches. * all wards of the [[London city, England#Subordinates|City of London]]. * more than 500 other {{#ask: [[Category:Addresses]] [[Located in or near::London, England]] | ?Has description=Description | limit = 0 | searchlabel = London streets and buildings }}, many of them linked to [[Property:Has MoEML ID|Map of Early Modern London IDs]].
=== Wales ===
[[Wales]] represents the country and gives links to subordinates.
We now have a page for every:
* county: ** [[:Category:Counties of Wales]] lists all shires and probably all corporate counties by English names. ** [[:Category:Counties of Wales by Welsh name]] lists all shires and probably all corporate counties by Welsh names. * [[National Landscape Character Area (Wales)]]. * [[shrievalty]]. These are jurisdictions of [[sheriff]]s and are always represented separately from the county or city they are named after. * parliamentary constituency: listed in [[:Category:Constituencies of the Parliament of England and Wales]].
So far we only have a few example populated places, mostly near battlefields.
== People and animals ==
* [[:Category:Authors]] includes over 1,700 people who wrote sources relevant to the British Civil Wars but were not alive at the time. * [[:Category:Agents]] lists people and animals who were alive during the British Civil Wars. Includes: ** about 750 regicides and MPs who never had peerages ** all [[:Category:Saddlers (trading as)|saddlers]] and [[:Category:Harness makers (trading as)|harness makers]] who supplied the [[New Model Army]] in 1645-46 ** a small selection of other people ** [[Grey horse (George Willingham's)|one horse]].
=== Allegiance ===
* [[Concept:Parliamentarian and Protectorate personnel]] should list all people who were members of organizations whose allegiance was to the [[Parliamentarian and Protectorate forces]] but it needs more testing when we have more parliamentarian units and personnel. Then concepts can be created for other factions.
== Units ==
* [[:Category:Units]] lists all organizations that we class as units. This can include military units, ships, committees, livery companies, households. * [[New Model Army#Tactical_subordinates]] lists all original regiments of the New Model Army formed in 1645. * Short Parliament: ** [[House of Lords, Short Parliament]] ** [[House of Commons, Short Parliament]]
== Events ==
* [[:Category:Events]] lists all events. * a selection of battles and sieges in Great Britain, including every battle that is covered by the Battlefields Trust: ** [[Map of combat events]] * every day of the Short Parliament: ** [[Events:House of Lords, Short Parliament|House of Lords]] ** [[Events:House of Commons, Short Parliament|House of Commons]]
== Sources ==
* [[:Category:GLAMs]] lists archives and libraries that hold manuscripts or early printed copies. Only three examples for now.
=== Manuscripts ===
* [[:Category:Collections]] lists collections within GLAMs. For now these are only manuscript collections but they will later include early printed books. * [[:Category:Manuscript texts]] lists manuscripts that still exist and whose location and catalogue reference is known. * [[:Category:Lost manuscript texts]] lists manuscripts that no longer exist, or whose location is unknown, or that do not have catalogue references.
[[TNA, SP 28]] (aka Commonwealth Exchequer Papers) has a page for every piece but not yet for every item. Pay warrants from 1642 to 1648 have extra levels that are not represented in TNA's catalogue but are not yet catalogued at folio level.
=== Books ===
* [[:Category:Book editions]] gives the simplest overview of books that are currently represented here. Mostly a few tests and some especially important reference books. * [[Century of the Soldier (Helion)#Contents]] lists all books in this series that are about the British Civil Wars and that were published up to March 2020. Forthcoming titles are not yet included.
=== Articles and chapters ===
* [[:Category:Articles]] lists journal articles and chapters in edited collections. * [[:Category:Serial publications]] lists journals and series of monographs. Only a small selection so far. * [[Midland History]] is a journal with linked contents for all articles relevant to the British Civil Wars up to March 2020.
=== Theses ===
* [[:Category:Theses]] lists unpublished theses and dissertations. We now have more than 600, mostly from EThOS.

Possible values are listed in [[:Category:Allegiance factions]].

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date when a will was proved by a probate court. It is only used by instances of [[will (registered copy)]] and not by any other type of manuscript text. The date of probate is not assumed to be the earliest date when the registered copy existed.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It represents the date on which a [[will (registered copy)|proved will]] was originally made. This can be the same as [[Property:Signed on date]] for the original will, but it is useful to record it as a property of the registered copy because:
* the date made is always stated in the registered copy. * it can be difficult to create a separate page to represent original wills in [[TNA, PROB 10]] because they are not as well catalogued or easy to reference as the registered copies in [[TNA, PROB 11]], and it is not always certain that the original still survives unless it has been found. * a nuncupative will is only recorded in the probate register and does not have a written original.

This is a property of type [[Has type::External identifier]]. It corresponds to a unique number assigned by [[The National Archives of the UK (TNA)|The National Archives of the UK]] to identify archives. It will be automatically formatted as a URI in this form (where $1 is the value you entered):
[[External formatter uri::http://discovery.nationalarchives.gov.uk/details/a?_ref=$1]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It shows that a page is a class of things that is a more specific subset of the page that is a value of the property, not an individual instance of that class.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Page]]. It is used for [[book format]]s published in the 17th century to record:
* the place where the book was published, if known from the book itself or any other source. * the place where the book was to be sold, if this is stated on the title page of the book.
This property can have multiple values because both of the above might be known and might be different from each other.

{{#default_form:Type definition}}
[[Category:Property values]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It shows the months when new issues of a [[serial publication]] are usually published. If the series is not expected to be published in future, or it is a book series that does not have issues, the value should be 'None'.
The allowed values for this property are: * [[Allows value::Jan]] * [[Allows value::Feb]] * [[Allows value::Mar]] * [[Allows value::Apr]] * [[Allows value::May]] * [[Allows value::Jun]] * [[Allows value::Jul]] * [[Allows value::Aug]] * [[Allows value::Sep]] * [[Allows value::Oct]] * [[Allows value::Nov]] * [[Allows value::Dec]] * [[Allows value::None]] * [[Allows value::Unknown]]

This is a property of type [[Has type::Date]]. It shows when the contents of a [[serial publication]] were last updated in this wiki, or when a new issue was checked and no relevant articles were found. NOT when the serial itself was last published.

This is a property of type [[Has type::Text]]. It records the spelling that a historical person used when they wrote their own name. If the original spelling is recorded using this property, there is less need for the page name to match the spelling, but there should at least be a redirect for the original spelling.
The default value is 'Unknown', which means it is not yet known whether a person wrote their own name or how they spelt it.
In some special cases, the values should be:
* 'Mark' if the person is only known to have used a mark or initials. * 'Title' if the person is only known to have signed with a title instead of their name during the period covered by this project. This often applies to peers and bishops.
